website_summaries.verdict: The Klipsch R-4B sound bar delivers decent features and sound quality, but better alternatives are available for the same price.
pros: The Klipsch R-4B offers an excellent build quality and a subwoofer constructed of wood instead of plastic
The speaker is capable of decent cinema sound for the money
cons: The speaker lacks DTS decoding meaning you need to use PCM digital to play all of your movies
The features count is a little low in comparison to competitors which offer HDMI and wi-fi connectivity
The sound can be a little too bright playing back music

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a full 5.1 Klipsch surround system. Wife wanted more minimal look in the place and we dont need the full woopty beat anymore with young human spawns destroying our life. The sound bar is 99% used for dora, daniel tiger, and lots of other animateds, but sometimes when i have the house to myself i liek to drugs and alcohol super hardly and pretend my life is awesome with loud rap music (also im hella gangster in my pretend awesome life). This speaker helps facilitate thug life success almost as gangsterly as my 5.1 system. Hits pretty hard for the small package.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Much better sounding than the one it was replacing.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Vizio soundbar that I had in my eat in kitchen area. With the Vizio, we found ourselves turning up the volume because we had trouble understanding the dialogue. I have Kilpsch speakers and subwoofers in 3 different rooms and decided to give one of their soundbars a chance. It was such a major difference that even my wife commented on the difference. Normally, she just smiles and nods when I change out speakers and such but she really noticed a difference with this. Sounds great with TV shows, movies and with music. The bluetooth connection for music really works good.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: The remote is great, quality is outstanding.
customer_reviews.text: Room noise (air conditioner coming on and off, refrigerator ice maker, etc.) would interfere with the quality of the sound from our TV making it hard to hear conversations. We'd always be saying, "What did he say?". With this sound bar we hear everything, each word, even those softly spoken are clear and we love the quality.

customer_reviews.title: Works very well in my shop.
customer_reviews.text: I use this connected to my iPhone so that I can listen to my music, podcasts, or internet radio. It is more than loud enough for my 700 ft. garage/shop. The instruction booklet is a series of pictograms. Physical installation was very simple. Initial set-up was not so much (lost 1 star). The pictograms do not clearly show how long (a few minutes) one must wait for the bar and woofer to link. After the link with the woofer is completed it is best to turn the system off and back on again before continuing with the device pairing. Subsequent device pairing has been flawless so far.

customer_reviews.title: Bedroom listening.
customer_reviews.text: I would consider myself a audiophile, my living room is set up with a real nice 7.1, but I needed something for late night watching where I wouldn’t lose quality with volume. I hung the main piece right behind my headboard and placed the sub next to me bed. At the lowest volumes you still feel like you are getting evrery high, medium and low. When played louder the quality is just as strong as well. The only down fall is the lack of indication of where the volume is set to. You have to listen and decide if you want it louder or quieter without knowing how far you have to choose from.

customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hoge

customer_reviews.title: Lots of issues. Sound is good, but remote, pairing, setup, display and other issues make this a tough choice.
customer_reviews.text: I could write a lot here. Read the other reviews for more details. In a nutshell, the unit sounds great, B/B+, but other issues make it an item I would not repurchase. The tiny remote has buttons that just don't work right often. Poor design. Second, the lack of any real display makes setup or even adding a new device a challenge. Very odd tiny colors. Hard to turn on/off and VERY hard to pair a new device. Sub is clearly and afterthought. I'm not sure it even goes on all the time. Ugh. Sorry, this unit is only so-so due to many many techical issues.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Moloney

customer_reviews.author: brock gudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Did not live up to expectations :(
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to setup, Sounds perfect when working, Enough bass for movies and sports, Price, Bluetooth, Loud. Cons: Subwoofer, Cheap small remote control broke in 2 months, Soundbar would randomly turn off when scrolling through apps on the Roku, Apple TV and Xbox one- to the point it was annoying and that's what gave me the desire to return it. Overall I would only recommend it if you do not mind turning the sounbar on constantly after scrolling through apps, (i.e. Going between Netflix, Hulo, HBO go and movies in those apps). If you do purchase I highly recommend you purchase insurance for it and a universal remote control. May you have better luck!
customer_reviews.author: Victor Santana

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Sound was great for the whole 5 minutes it worked. Very very disappointed in this product I was very excited and was going to use it for a BBQ get together later today. I tried it out last night worked fine on the test run for a few minutes then went to use it today and turns on but will turn off by itself after a minute. Will be getting my money back for this P.O.S.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth 400, 250, or 200.
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth the 200 dollars I paid for it on Black Friday. It has absolutely no mid range sound. You get some bass and all of the top range of music and TV shows but things like the melody of songs are almost mute. I have a plug in speaker that cost me 30 dollars from Altec that is louder and clearer in sound with exception to the bass from the provided sub woofer which is sub par at best. I had this out of the box and plugged in for about 10 minutes before it was back in the box and ready to be returned. Don't waste your time, or money at any price point.

customer_reviews.title: Can't save volume and bass settings, no wall mount brackets
customer_reviews.text: The volume and the bass settings return to default after turning it off. The soundbar does provide enough bass. I can't believe the package DOESN'T come with a wall mount brackets! Bad design and disappointed. I always thought Klipsch was a good brand, I guess I was wrong.
